Newly qualified pharmacists start on Band 6, where salaries range from £31,365 to £37,890.
With further study and training, it's possible to progress to Band 7 where salaries are set at £38,890 to £44,503.
Roles at senior level include advanced pharmacist, consultant pharmacist, team manager and professional manager of pharmaceutical services. Salaries range from £45,753 to £87,754 (Band 8a to 8d) depending on knowledge, training and experience. As a most senior manager of pharmaceutical services, you could earn between £91,004 and £104,927 (Band 9).

Newly qualified pharmacists start on Band 6, where salaries range from £31,365 to £37,890.
With further study and training, it's possible to progress to Band 7 where salaries are set at £38,890 to £44,503.
Roles at senior level include advanced pharmacist, consultant pharmacist, team manager and professional manager of pharmaceutical services. Salaries range from £45,753 to £87,754 (Band 8a to 8d) depending on knowledge, training and experience. As a most senior manager of pharmaceutical services, you could earn between £91,004 and £104,927 (Band 9).
